page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Bettyhill is a small village in the Highland Region. Although its postal address is By Thurso, Caithness, it is part of Sutherland District. It is made up of scattered houses with only a few council houses marking the village centre. It has a remarkable number of facilities for such a small place - a combined primary/secondary school, a post office cum shop, a store, a caravan site two churches, a public hall, a bank and a museum. Many of the people provide local government services - teachers, roadmen, dustmen and policemen. The only large scale industry is at Dounreay, twenty-five miles away. A small building firm employs six people, and the Forestry Commission employs twenty-three people from the area. Part time work is available seasonally in the two hotels.
